storyTitle: As System Administrator, I want to configure OAuth 2.0 authentication to achieve secure API access

testCases.title: Verify system successfully obtains OAuth 2.0 access tokens using valid client credentials
preconditions: System Administrator has valid OAuth 2.0 client ID and client secret
OAuth provider endpoint is available and responding
System has network connectivity to OAuth provider
Secure vault for credential storage is configured

steps.action: Navigate to API settings page as System Administrator
steps.expectedResult: API settings page loads successfully with OAuth configuration section visible

steps.action: Locate the OAuth 2.0 configuration section
steps.expectedResult: OAuth configuration fields for Client ID and Client Secret are displayed

steps.action: Enter valid OAuth Client ID in the Client ID field
steps.expectedResult: Client ID is accepted and displayed in the input field

steps.action: Enter valid OAuth Client Secret in the Client Secret field
steps.expectedResult: Client Secret is accepted and masked for security

steps.action: Click 'Save' or 'Connect' button to submit credentials
steps.expectedResult: System initiates OAuth token request to /oauth/token endpoint

steps.action: Observe system response after credential submission
steps.expectedResult: System displays success message indicating token obtained successfully

steps.action: Verify access token is received in system logs or token status indicator
steps.expectedResult: Access token is present with valid format and expiry timestamp

steps.action: Check that token acquisition completed within performance requirements
steps.expectedResult: Token acquisition completed within 1 second

postconditions: Valid OAuth 2.0 access token is stored in the system
System is authenticated and ready to make API requests
Authentication event is logged in system logs
Token expiry time is recorded

testCases.title: Verify system securely stores and encrypts OAuth tokens preventing unauthorized access
preconditions: System has successfully obtained OAuth 2.0 access token
Secure vault with encryption is configured
System Administrator has access to verify storage mechanisms

steps.action: After successful token acquisition, access the secure vault or token storage location
steps.expectedResult: Token storage location is accessible to authorized administrators only

steps.action: Verify that the stored token is encrypted and not in plain text
steps.expectedResult: Token is stored in encrypted format, not readable as plain text

steps.action: Check encryption algorithm used for token storage
steps.expectedResult: Industry-standard encryption algorithm (AES-256 or equivalent) is used

steps.action: Attempt to access token storage without proper authorization credentials
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied with appropriate error message

steps.action: Verify that token transmission uses TLS encryption
steps.expectedResult: All token-related communications use TLS 1.2 or higher

steps.action: Check system logs for token storage event
steps.expectedResult: Log entry shows token stored securely without exposing token value

steps.action: Verify that client secret is also encrypted in storage
steps.expectedResult: Client secret is encrypted and not visible in plain text

postconditions: OAuth tokens are stored in encrypted format
Unauthorized access to tokens is prevented
Security audit trail is maintained
All credentials remain confidential

testCases.title: Verify system automatically refreshes access tokens before expiration without manual intervention
preconditions: System has valid OAuth 2.0 access token with known expiry time
System has valid refresh token (if applicable)
Automatic refresh is enabled in system settings

steps.action: Note the current access token and its expiry timestamp
steps.expectedResult: Current token details including expiry time are visible in system

steps.action: Wait until system approaches token expiry threshold (typically 5 minutes before expiry)
steps.expectedResult: System continues normal operation during waiting period

steps.action: Monitor system logs for automatic token refresh initiation
steps.expectedResult: System automatically initiates token refresh request before expiration

steps.action: Verify that refresh request is sent to /oauth/token endpoint
steps.expectedResult: Token refresh request is sent with appropriate grant_type parameter

steps.action: Observe system response to refresh request
steps.expectedResult: New access token is obtained successfully

steps.action: Verify that token refresh completed within performance requirements
steps.expectedResult: Token refresh completed within 1 second

steps.action: Confirm that new token replaces old token in secure storage
steps.expectedResult: New token is stored and old token is invalidated

steps.action: Verify that API requests continue without interruption
steps.expectedResult: No API request failures occur during token refresh

steps.action: Check authentication logs for refresh event
steps.expectedResult: Token refresh event is logged with timestamp and success status

postconditions: New valid access token is active in the system
Old token is invalidated
Token refresh event is logged
API access continues uninterrupted
No manual intervention was required

testCases.title: Verify system rejects API requests with invalid tokens and logs these events
preconditions: Test environment allows token manipulation for testing
API endpoints are available for testing

steps.action: Prepare an API request with an invalid access token (malformed token)
steps.expectedResult: API request is ready with invalid token in authorization header

steps.action: Submit the API request with invalid token
steps.expectedResult: System rejects the request with 401 Unauthorized status code

steps.action: Verify error response message indicates invalid token
steps.expectedResult: Error message clearly states 'Invalid token' or similar

steps.action: Check authentication logs for rejected request event
steps.expectedResult: Log entry shows rejected request with timestamp, token status, and reason

steps.action: Prepare an API request with an expired access token
steps.expectedResult: API request is ready with expired token

steps.action: Submit the API request with expired token
steps.expectedResult: System rejects the request with 401 Unauthorized status code

steps.action: Verify error response indicates token expiration
steps.expectedResult: Error message states 'Token expired' or similar

steps.action: Check authentication logs for expired token event
steps.expectedResult: Log entry shows rejected request due to token expiration

steps.action: Attempt API request with no token provided
steps.expectedResult: System rejects request with 401 Unauthorized status code

steps.action: Verify all rejection events are logged with appropriate details
steps.expectedResult: All unauthorized access attempts are logged with timestamp, IP, and reason

postconditions: All invalid token requests are rejected
No unauthorized API access occurred
All rejection events are logged in authentication logs
System security is maintained
Zero unauthorized API access attempts recorded

testCases.title: Verify system rejects API requests with expired tokens and logs these events
preconditions: Access to expired token for testing purposes
System logging is enabled and accessible
API endpoints are available for testing

steps.action: Obtain or create an expired OAuth access token for testing
steps.expectedResult: Expired token is available with past expiry timestamp

steps.action: Prepare an API request using the expired token
steps.expectedResult: API request is configured with expired token in authorization header

steps.action: Submit the API request to a protected endpoint
steps.expectedResult: System validates token and detects expiration

steps.action: Verify the API response status code
steps.expectedResult: System returns 401 Unauthorized status code

steps.action: Check the error response body for expiration message
steps.expectedResult: Response contains clear message indicating token has expired

steps.action: Navigate to authentication logs section
steps.expectedResult: Authentication logs page loads successfully

steps.action: Search for the rejected request event in logs
steps.expectedResult: Log entry exists for the rejected request with expired token

steps.action: Verify log entry contains timestamp, token status, and rejection reason
steps.expectedResult: Log shows timestamp, 'Token Expired' status, and request details

steps.action: Confirm that no API data was returned with the rejected request
steps.expectedResult: No sensitive data or API response payload is included in error response

steps.action: Verify that expired token event contributes to security metrics
steps.expectedResult: Event is counted in unauthorized access attempt metrics

postconditions: Expired token request is rejected
No unauthorized data access occurred
Event is logged in authentication logs
Security metrics are updated
System maintains zero unauthorized access success rate

steps.action: Log in to the system as System Administrator
steps.expectedResult: Administrator successfully logs in and dashboard is displayed

steps.action: Navigate to API settings or configuration section
steps.expectedResult: API settings page is accessible and loads successfully

steps.action: Locate OAuth 2.0 configuration section on the page
steps.expectedResult: OAuth configuration section is clearly visible with appropriate labels

steps.action: Verify presence of Client ID input field
steps.expectedResult: Client ID field is present with clear label and input validation

steps.action: Verify presence of Client Secret input field
steps.expectedResult: Client Secret field is present with password masking enabled

steps.action: Check for OAuth provider endpoint configuration option
steps.expectedResult: OAuth endpoint URL field is available for configuration

steps.action: Verify presence of Save/Submit button
steps.expectedResult: Action button is clearly labeled and enabled

steps.action: Check for Test Connection or Validate Credentials option
steps.expectedResult: Option to test credentials before saving is available

steps.action: Verify interface displays current connection status

testCases.title: Verify system provides an interface for administrators to update OAuth credentials
preconditions: Existing OAuth credentials are already configured

steps.action: Navigate to API settings page
steps.expectedResult: API settings page loads with existing OAuth configuration displayed

steps.action: Verify current OAuth credentials are displayed (masked for security)
steps.expectedResult: Current Client ID is visible, Client Secret is masked

steps.action: Click Edit or Update button for OAuth configuration
steps.expectedResult: OAuth configuration fields become editable

steps.action: Update the Client ID field with new valid Client ID
steps.expectedResult: New Client ID is accepted and displayed in the field

steps.action: Update the Client Secret field with new valid Client Secret
steps.expectedResult: New Client Secret is accepted and masked

steps.action: Click Save or Update button to submit changes
steps.expectedResult: System validates new credentials and initiates token request

steps.action: Observe system response after credential update
steps.expectedResult: Success message confirms credentials updated and new token obtained

steps.action: Verify old token is invalidated and new token is active
steps.expectedResult: New token is stored and old token is no longer used

steps.action: Check authentication logs for credential update event
steps.expectedResult: Log entry shows credential update with timestamp and administrator ID

steps.action: Verify API requests use new credentials successfully
steps.expectedResult: API requests are authenticated with new token without errors

postconditions: OAuth credentials are updated in the system
New access token is obtained and stored
Old credentials are replaced
Update event is logged
API access continues with new credentials

testCases.title: Verify system validates OAuth credentials format before submission

steps.action: Navigate to OAuth configuration section
steps.expectedResult: OAuth configuration fields are displayed and ready for input

steps.action: Leave Client ID field empty and attempt to save
steps.expectedResult: Validation error message indicates Client ID is required

steps.action: Enter invalid characters or format in Client ID field
steps.expectedResult: Validation error indicates invalid Client ID format

steps.action: Leave Client Secret field empty and attempt to save
steps.expectedResult: Validation error message indicates Client Secret is required

steps.action: Enter Client Secret that is too short (below minimum length)
steps.expectedResult: Validation error indicates Client Secret does not meet minimum length

steps.action: Enter excessively long string in Client ID field (beyond maximum)
steps.expectedResult: Validation error or field limits input to maximum allowed length

steps.action: Enter special characters that are not allowed in credentials
steps.expectedResult: Validation error indicates invalid characters detected

steps.action: Verify that Save button remains disabled until validation passes
steps.expectedResult: Save button is disabled when validation errors exist

steps.action: Enter valid credentials in both fields
steps.expectedResult: Validation passes and Save button becomes enabled

steps.action: Verify validation messages are clear and helpful
steps.expectedResult: All validation messages provide clear guidance on requirements

postconditions: Invalid credentials are not submitted to the system
User receives clear validation feedback
System prevents configuration errors
Only valid format credentials can be saved

testCases.title: Verify system handles OAuth provider unavailability gracefully
preconditions: OAuth provider endpoint can be made unavailable for testing

steps.action: Simulate OAuth provider endpoint being unavailable (network error or timeout)
steps.expectedResult: OAuth provider is unreachable from the system

steps.action: Attempt to obtain new access token with provider unavailable
steps.expectedResult: System detects connection failure to OAuth provider

steps.action: Verify system displays appropriate error message to administrator
steps.expectedResult: Error message indicates OAuth provider is unavailable or unreachable

steps.action: Check that system does not crash or become unresponsive
steps.expectedResult: System remains stable and responsive despite provider unavailability

steps.action: Verify error is logged in authentication logs
steps.expectedResult: Log entry shows connection failure with timestamp and error details

steps.action: Check if system implements retry mechanism
steps.expectedResult: System attempts retry with exponential backoff (if configured)

steps.action: Verify existing valid token continues to work during provider outage
steps.expectedResult: API requests with valid existing token continue to function

steps.action: Restore OAuth provider availability
steps.expectedResult: OAuth provider becomes reachable again

steps.action: Verify system automatically recovers and can obtain tokens
steps.expectedResult: System successfully obtains new token once provider is available

steps.action: Check recovery event is logged
steps.expectedResult: Log entry shows successful reconnection to OAuth provider

postconditions: System handles provider unavailability without crashing
Appropriate error messages are displayed
Events are logged for troubleshooting
System recovers automatically when provider is available
Existing valid tokens continue to function during outage

testCases.title: Verify token refresh performance meets requirement of under 1 second
preconditions: System has valid OAuth access token approaching expiration
Token refresh mechanism is configured and enabled
Network conditions are stable for accurate measurement

steps.action: Set up performance monitoring to measure token refresh duration
steps.expectedResult: Performance monitoring is active and ready to capture metrics

steps.action: Note the current access token and its expiry time
steps.expectedResult: Current token details are recorded for comparison

steps.action: Wait for automatic token refresh to trigger
steps.expectedResult: System initiates token refresh before expiration

steps.action: Record the start time when refresh request is initiated
steps.expectedResult: Start timestamp is captured accurately

steps.action: Monitor the token refresh process
steps.expectedResult: Refresh request is sent to OAuth provider

steps.action: Record the end time when new token is received and stored
steps.expectedResult: End timestamp is captured when refresh completes

steps.action: Calculate total duration of token refresh operation
steps.expectedResult: Duration is calculated as end time minus start time

steps.action: Verify token refresh duration is under 1 second
steps.expectedResult: Total refresh time is less than 1000 milliseconds

steps.action: Repeat token refresh test multiple times (at least 5 iterations)
steps.expectedResult: All iterations complete with refresh time under 1 second

steps.action: Check performance logs for refresh latency metrics
steps.expectedResult: Performance logs show consistent refresh times under 1 second

steps.action: Verify API requests are not delayed during token refresh
steps.expectedResult: No API request timeouts or delays occur during refresh

postconditions: Token refresh performance meets requirement of under 1 second
Performance metrics are documented
System maintains performance SLA
No service interruption during token refresh

steps.action: Verify rejection is logged and no data is returned
steps.expectedResult: Unauthorized attempt is logged, no API data exposed

steps.action: Attempt API request with malformed token
steps.expectedResult: Request is rejected with 401 Unauthorized status

steps.action: Verify malformed token attempt is logged
steps.expectedResult: Event is logged with details of malformed token

steps.action: Attempt API request with expired token

steps.action: Verify expired token attempt is logged
steps.expectedResult: Event is logged indicating token expiration

steps.action: Attempt API request with token from different OAuth client

steps.action: Verify invalid client token attempt is logged
steps.expectedResult: Event is logged showing token validation failure

steps.action: Attempt API request with revoked token
steps.expectedResult: Request is rejected with 401 Unauthorized status

steps.action: Verify revoked token attempt is logged
steps.expectedResult: Event is logged indicating token was revoked

steps.action: Review all unauthorized access attempts in logs

steps.action: Calculate success rate of preventing unauthorized access
steps.expectedResult: 100% of unauthorized attempts were successfully blocked

steps.action: Verify no sensitive data was exposed in any rejection response

100% prevention rate is achieved
All unauthorized attempts are logged

Security metrics confirm success criteria met
